The extracellular ionic strength effects the release of VOCs including the short chain aliphatic hydrocarbons ethane, propane, butane and pentane. Production of VOCs was greatest at lower ionic strengths and was reduced considerably at higher ionic strengths. It is proposed that these VOCs are produced as a by-product of not needing as much glycerol for osmotic regulation.
